A **baby purple worm**, w, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") in that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a [slithy](/wiki/Slithy "Slithy"), [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous") [worm](/wiki/Worm "Worm") that is a juvenile form of the [purple worm](/wiki/Purple_worm "Purple worm").

Baby purple worms possess a single bite attack.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Baby purple worms can sense [shriekers](/wiki/Shrieker "Shrieker") like their adult selves, and a [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") [polymorphed](/wiki/Polyself "Polyself") into a baby purple worm is [warned of shriekers on the level](/wiki/Warned_of_monster_type "Warned of monster type").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Origin](#Origin)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 GruntHack](#GruntHack)
  - [5.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)

- [6 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Generation

Randomly generated baby purple worms are always created hostile. A baby purple worm can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into a purple worm, and purple worm [eggs](/wiki/Egg "Egg") can hatch into baby purple worms.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

A shrieker that would summon a purple worm with its shriek will instead generate a baby purple worm if a purple worm would be out-of-depth.

## Strategy

Baby purple worms are not particularly remarkable monsters to encounter, and can be dispatched with ease by most heroes - those willing to invest the time and energy into taming and raising one will be rewarded with a powerful pet in the purple worm, which can [engulf](/wiki/Engulf "Engulf") monsters up to [large](/wiki/Large "Large") size and instantly kill them via [digestion](/wiki/Digestion "Digestion").

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

A shrieker summoning a baby purple worms may provide an opportunity for an early hero to gain a significant amount of experience from killing it - especially-fortunate heroes can potentially take advantage of this to even tame one and raise it to adulthood for a powerful early pet.

## History

The baby purple worm first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Origin

The purple worm originates from *[Dungeons & Dragons](/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons "Dungeons & Dragons")*, where they debut in the 1st Edition *Monster Manual*. Purple worms are monstrous, subterranean egg-laying creatures that resemble enormous and bizarre earthworms, with a chitinous plated hide that is dark purple in hue, a toothy maw, and a stinger at the rear end that contains a potent venom. Freshly-hatched purple worms are known as purple wormlings while less than 6 weeks old, and are up to about 9 feet (2.7 m) in length and weigh 1,500 lb (680 kg) - they also lack the tail stinger of the mature purple worm.

## Variants

### GruntHack

In [GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack"), the baby purple worm's [difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty") is lowered to 7.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), baby purple worms can slither between [iron bars](/wiki/Iron_bars "Iron bars").

## Encyclopedia entry

A gargantuan version of the harmless rain-worm, the purple worm poses a huge threat to the ordinary adventurer. It is known to swallow whole and digest its victims within only a few minutes. These worms are always on guard, sensitive to the most minute vibrations in the earth, but may also be awakened by a remote shriek.
